Fact.Name: Claimed Spouse Combat Pay without a Spouse
Fact.Description: Filer selected a combat pay option referencing a spouse without having a spouse

Fact.Name: Combat pay election
Fact.Description:
Whether the taxpayer elects to include their nontaxable combat pay for EITC.
They may choose to elect their own combat pay, their spouse's combat pay separately, or both of their combat pay should they each have combat pay.

Fact.Name: Earned income credit (EITC)
Fact.Description:
Earned income credit (EITC) (line 27 1040)
We calculate the EITC up to four times -- EITC may be calculated with: 1. No combat pay (for people without combat pay, and people who elect not to include their combat pay) 2. With the primary filer's combat pay 3. With the secondary filer's combat pay 4. With both filer's combined combat pay.
If a user qualifies for more than 1 of those options (most taxpayers do not have combat pay and will therefore default into the "no combat pay" option), we guide the taxpayer towards electing the combat pay option that will give them the most EITC.

Fact.Name: Is receiving EITC
Fact.Description: Whether the TP is receiving EITC
The maximum amount of EITC that can be receieved based on the taxpayer's AGI.

Fact.Name: The amount of the Earned Income Tax Credit without combat pay
Fact.Description: The amount of EITC, if the taxpayer is eligible. Magic numbers come from https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-drop/rp-21-45.pdf and will need to be updated for 2023 with https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-drop/rp-22-38.pdf

Fact.Name: Rounded earned income for EITC without combat pay
Fact.Description: In order to match the EITC table from Publication 596, we must round the income to match the rows, which use increments of $50, calculating the amount of the credit for the midpoint of row (i.e. $25, $75, $125, etc.).

Fact.Name: The amount of the Earned Income Tax Credit with primary filer combat pay
Fact.Description: The amount of EITC, if the taxpayer is eligible. Magic numbers come from https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-drop/rp-21-45.pdf and will need to be updated for 2023 with https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-drop/rp-22-38.pdf

Fact.Name: Earned income plus primary combat pay
Rounded earned income for EITC with a primary filer's combat pay
Fact.Description: In order to match the EITC table from Publication 596, we must round the income to match the rows, which use increments of $50, calculating the amount of the credit for the midpoint of row (i.e. $25, $75, $125, etc.).

Fact.Name: The amount of the Earned Income Tax Credit with secondary filer combat pay
Fact.Description: The amount of EITC, if the taxpayer is eligible. Magic numbers come from https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-drop/rp-21-45.pdf and will need to be updated for 2023 with https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-drop/rp-22-38.pdf

Fact.Name: Earned income plus spouse combat pay
Rounded earned income for EITC with an MFJ spouse's combat pay
Fact.Description: In order to match the EITC table from Publication 596, we must round the income to match the rows, which use increments of $50, calculating the amount of the credit for the midpoint of row (i.e. $25, $75, $125, etc.).

Fact.Name: The amount of the Earned Income Tax Credit with secondary filer combat pay
Fact.Description: The amount of EITC, if the taxpayer is eligible. Magic numbers come from https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-drop/rp-21-45.pdf and will need to be updated for 2023 with https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-drop/rp-22-38.pdf

Fact.Name: Earned income plus primary and spouse combat pay
Rounded earned income for EITC with an MFJ spouse's combat pay
Fact.Description: In order to match the EITC table from Publication 596, we must round the income to match the rows, which use increments of $50, calculating the amount of the credit for the midpoint of row (i.e. $25, $75, $125, etc.).

Fact.Name: Rounded AGI for EITC
Fact.Description: In order to match the EITC table from Publication 596, we must round the income to match the rows, which use increments of $50, calculating the amount of the credit for the midpoint of row (i.e. $25, $75, $125, etc.).

Fact.Name: EITC maximum credit amount
Fact.Description: The maximum amount of EITC a taxpayer can recieve, depending on the number of qualifying children.

Fact.Name: Maximum phase in amount with 0 children
Fact.Description: The earned income amount which provides the max EITC with 0 qualifying children Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(b)

Fact.Name: Maximum phase in amount with 1 child
Fact.Description: The earned income amount which provides the max EITC with 1 qualifying child Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(b)

Fact.Name: Maximum phase in amount with 2 or more children
Fact.Description: The earned income amount which provides the max EITC with 2 or more qualifying children Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(b)

Fact.Name: Maximum EITC amount with 0 children
Fact.Description: The maximum earned income tax credit with 0 qualifying children

Fact.Name: Maximum EITC amount with 1 child
Fact.Description: The maximum earned income tax credit with 1 qualifying child

Fact.Name: Maximum EITC amount with 2 children
Fact.Description: The maximum earned income tax credit with 2 qualifying children

Fact.Name: Maximum EITC amount with 3 or more children
Fact.Description: The maximum earned income tax credit with 3 or more qualifying children

Fact.Name: Rounded maximum EITC amount with 0 children
Fact.Description: The rounded version of maxEitcWith0QualifyingChildren

Fact.Name: Rounded maximum EITC amount with 1 child
Fact.Description: The rounded version of maxEitcWith1QualifyingChild

Fact.Name: Rounded maximum EITC amount with 2 children
Fact.Description: The rounded version of maxEitcWith2QualifyingChildren

Fact.Name: Rounded maximum EITC amount with 3 ore more children
Fact.Description: The rounded version of maxEitcWith3OrMoreQualifyingChildren

Fact.Name: Phase in rate for 0 qualifying children
Phase in rate for 1 qualifying child
Phase in rate for 2 qualifying children
Phase in rate for 3 or more qualifying children
EITC phase in rate
Fact.Description: The rate at which EITC phases in with income.

Fact.Name: EITC phase out rate
Fact.Description: The rate at which EITC phases out as income exceeds the threshold amount.

Fact.Name: EITC phaseout amount threshold
Fact.Description: The amount of income above which the amount of EITC begins to be reduced. Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(b)

Fact.Name: Below EITC Investment Income Limit
Fact.Description: Whether the TP's Investment Income is low enough for the EITC Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(i)

Fact.Name: EITC QC Of Another
Fact.Description: Whether the TP or their spouse, if applicable, could be someone else's QC for EITC

Fact.Name: EITC QC Of Another Required to file
Fact.Description: Whether the person who can claim TP or SP as a QC for EITC is required tofile

Fact.Name: EITC QC Of Another is filing
Fact.Description: Whether the person who can claim TP or SP as a QC for EITC is filing

Fact.Name: EITC QC Of Another is filing
Fact.Description: Whether the person who can claim TP or SP as a QC for EITC is filing for a refund only

Fact.Name: Flow whether to show eitc qc summary
Fact.Description: Whether to show that the TP is eligible for EITC despite being QC of another.

Fact.Name: EITC QC Test
Fact.Description: Whether the TP qualifies for EITC when accounting for the possibility that they could be the QC of another TP.

Fact.Name: Fails EITC QC Test
Fact.Description: Whether the TP does not qualify for EITC when accounting for the possibility that they could be the QC of another TP. Used in Schedule 8862 to answer Part II line 4

Fact.Name: Form 8862 Line 4 Yes checkbox
Fact.Description: Whether the PDF checkbox should be checked.

Fact.Name: Form 8862 Line 4 No checkbox
Fact.Description: Whether the PDF checkbox should be checked.

Fact.Name: EITC Had Improper Claims
Fact.Description: Whether the TP (or their spouse, if applicable) has had their EITC reduced or disallowed for any reason other than a math error.

Fact.Name: EITC Improper Claims Due to QC
Fact.Description: Whether the EITC was reduced or disallowed due to a child not being qualifying

Fact.Name: EITC Had Improper Claims
Fact.Description: Whether the TP (or their spouse, if applicable) has taken the EITC again since they were disallowed

Fact.Name: Received Eitc improper Claims notice
Fact.Description: Whether the TP received a letter from the IRS telling them they're not allowed to take EITC for a number of years

Fact.Name: EITC Notice Test
Fact.Description: Whether the TP is qualified for the EITC w.r.t having received an improper claims notice in the past

Fact.Name: EITC 8862 Required
Fact.Description: Whether the TP is required to file form 8862 to receive the EITC Part V is currently out of scope.

Fact.Name: Form 8862 required and has EITC qualifying children
Fact.Description: Form 8862 is required and TP has EITC qualifying children

Fact.Name: Form 8862 required and has no EITC qualifying children
Fact.Description: Form 8862 is required and TP does not have EITC qualifying children

Fact.Name: Form 8862 required and has no EITC qualifying children
Fact.Description: Form 8862 is required and TP does not have EITC qualifying children

Fact.Name: PDF should include Form 8862
Fact.Description: Whether the tax return PDF should include Form 8862, Information To CLaim Certain Credits After Disallowance.

Fact.Name: Whether the TP is eligible for the EITC
Fact.Description: Whether the TP passes various tests to be eligible for the Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) in finality, after the EITC sections of the flow

Fact.Name: Whether the TP may be eligible for the EITC
Fact.Description: Whether the TP passes various tests to be eligible for the Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) prior to the EITC section of the flow. After this, we still need to test 1. If the TP is the QC of another TP 2. If they have been disqualified from taking EITC by the IRS

Fact.Name: Whether the TP may be eligible for the EITC
Fact.Description: Whether the TP passes various tests to be eligible for the Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC)

Used for display in the flow. The TP doesn't have EITC because they are filing separately from their spouse (either MFS or HOH) and have no qualifying children or they did not meet the special rule for spearated spouses

Fact.Name: Whether the TP may be eligible for the EITC
Fact.Description: Whether the TP passes various tests to be eligible for the Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC)

Fact.Name: Has improper claims and no qc
Fact.Description: Whether the TP has had improper EITC claims and has no qualifying children

Fact.Name: Show EITC credits taken since disallowal question
Fact.Description: Checks whether the TP has taken improper claims and has qualifying children to determine if they should be asked about the last time they have taken the earned income tax credit

Fact.Name: TP(s) age test for EITC with no QC
Fact.Description: TP(s) age test for EITC with no qualifying children

Fact.Name: Whether the TP may be eligible for the EITC Base
Fact.Description: Base rules that define whhether the TP passes various tests to be eligible for the Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) before running child-specific tests

Fact.Name: Has zero EITC Qualifying Children
Fact.Description: Whether the TP(s) has zero EITC qualifying children

Fact.Name: Whether the unclaimed and/or deceased EITC QCs need more information.
Fact.Description: Whether the TP has unclaimed and/or deceased EITC QCs.

Fact.Name: Number of EITC Qualifying Children is greater than zero.
Fact.Description: The number of dependents who qualify as QCs for EITC is greater than zero.

Fact.Name: Has Earned Income
Fact.Description: Whether the TP had earned income

Fact.Name: EITC (MFJ) limit with 3 or more children
Fact.Description: EITC limit with 3 or more children when filing as MFJ Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(b)

Fact.Name: EITC (self) limit with 3 or more children
Fact.Description: EITC limit with 3 or more children when not filing as MFJ Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(b)

Fact.Name: EITC (MFJ) limit with 2 children
Fact.Description: EITC limit with 2 children when filing as MFJ Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(b)

Fact.Name: EITC (self) limit with 2 children
Fact.Description: EITC limit with 2 children when not filing as MFJ Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(b)

Fact.Name: EITC (MFJ) limit with 1 child
Fact.Description: EITC limit with 1 child when filing as MFJ Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(b)

Fact.Name: EITC (self) limit with 1 child
Fact.Description: EITC limit with 1 child when not filing as MFJ Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(b)

Fact.Name: EITC (MFJ) limit with 0 children
Fact.Description: EITC limit with 0 children when filing as MFJ Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(b)

Fact.Name: EITC (self) limit with 0 children
Fact.Description: EITC limit with 0 children when not filing as MFJ Rev Proc .06 Earned Income Credit §32(b)

Fact.Name: EITC Completed Phaseout Amount
Fact.Description: The amount of income at which EITC is completely phased out.

Fact.Name: Lower bound phase-out amount
Fact.Description: The lower bound of the midpoint range that is associated with the complete phase-out amount

Fact.Name: Below EITC Earned Income Limit
Fact.Description: Whether the TP's Earned Income is low enough for the EITC. We always test this without combat pay, since it will be the lesser of the two amounts. Later, we have to calculate if combat pay is more or less advantageous.

Fact.Name: Below EITC AGI Limit
Fact.Description: Whether the TP's AGI is low enough for the EITC

Fact.Name: EITC had an improper claims ban
Fact.Description: Whether the flow should ask a person if their CTC improper claims notice has expired

Fact.Name: EITC Improper Claims Notice Expired
Fact.Description: Whether the improper claims notice that the TP previously received is far enough in the past to be expired. E.g. They could not file for 2 years, and it has been at least 2 years

Fact.Name: PDF should include Schedule EIC
Fact.Description: Whether the tax return PDF should include Schedule EIC.
The TP is receiving EITC while they are married and filing separately from their sposue (either HOH or MFS) and there is a checkbox we must set in the pdf, and a field to send to MeF.

Fact.Name: Is the EITC amount with Primary combat pay greater than without combat pay
Fact.Description: Whether or not the EITC amount with Primary combat pay is greater then without combat pay

Fact.Name: Is the EITC amount with secondary combat pay greater than without combat pay
Fact.Description: Whether or not the EITC amount with secondary combat pay is greater then without combat pay

Fact.Name: Is the EITC amount with both combat pay is maximum
Fact.Description: Whether or not the EITC amount with both combat pays is greater primary, secondary, and without combat pay

Fact.Name: Is the EITC amount with primary combat pay is maximum
Fact.Description: Whether or not the EITC amount with primary combat pay is greater secondary, both and without combat pay

Fact.Name: Is the EITC amount with Secondary combat pay is maximum
Fact.Description: Whether or not the EITC amount with Secondary combat pay is greater secondary, both and without combat pay

Fact.Name: Is the EITC amount with primary combat pay greater than without combat pay
Fact.Description: Whether or not the EITC amount with primary combat pay is greater then without combat pay

Fact.Name: Is the combat pay election usePrimaryCombatPay
Fact.Description: Is the combat pay election useSpouseCombatPay

Fact.Name: Is the combat pay election useSpouseCombatPay
Fact.Description: Is the combat pay election useSpouseCombatPay

Fact.Name: Is the combat pay election useBothCombatPay
Fact.Description: Is the combat pay election useBothCombatPay

Fact.Name: Is the combat pay election noCombatPay
Fact.Description: Is the combat pay election noCombatPay

Fact.Name: Is the combat pay election usePrimaryNotSpouse
Fact.Description: Is the combat pay election usePrimaryNotSpouse

Fact.Name: Is the combat pay election useSpouseNotPrimary
Fact.Description: Is the combat pay election useSpouseNotPrimary

Fact.Name: Combat pay election and/or recommendation
Fact.Description: Sets this fact to recommendation only if there is no election
